sources.data_found: SMU NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD: Contains 20 NVIDIA DGX A100 systems; enables high-performance AI workloads.
M3 Cluster specs, SuperPOD specs, Faculty partner nodes (A100, V100, AMD MI210).
M3 gpu-dev partition: 3 nodes, 8x NVIDIA V100 GPUs per node.
ManeFrame II: 36 accelerator nodes, each with 1x NVIDIA P100 GPU.
Student enrollment Fall 2024: 230 undergrad, 227 grad, 43 PhD in CS.

student_data.notes: Counts reflect the highest values found across models. Gemini estimated higher counts (Undergrad: 416, Grad: 718, PhD: 55) based on IPEDS 'Degrees Awarded' data multiplied by program duration. OpenAI found specific Fall 2024 Registrar data showing lower confirmed enrollment (Undergrad: 230, Grad: 227, PhD: 43). The Grad estimate of 718 likely includes large online MS Data Science programs often grouped with CS in federal reporting.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: ManeFrame II Hagstrom node with quad K80 GPUs

gpu_resources.notes: Primary resource is the SMU AI SuperPOD with 20 nodes x 8 NVIDIA A100 80GB GPUs (160 total). Additional resources include the M3 cluster (containing V100s in the gpu-dev partition and faculty nodes, plus 1 A100 40GB) and the older ManeFrame II cluster. The P100 count of 113 is derived from 36 documented accelerator nodes plus 77 inferred from total reported GPU cores in older documentation.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. Discrepancies in student data exist between estimated figures (based on degrees awarded) and official Fall 2024 Registrar snapshots; highest values were retained per rules. GPU counts combine the DGX SuperPOD specs with various faculty-specific nodes on the M3 and ManeFrame II clusters.
validation_notes: GPU CHANGES: Reduced V100 count to 24 (3 nodes * 8 GPUs). Reduced P100 count to 36 (documented accelerator nodes). Removed K80 and Quadro M5000 GPUs as they are too old to be relevant.
